alert.note: Alert for Central Ventura County Valleys; Cuyama Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 3:45PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ventura, northwestern Los Angeles and north central Santa Barbara Counties through 445 PM PDT... At 344 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Lockwood Valley, or 19 miles north of Ojai, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lockwood Valley... Alamo Mountain... Gorman... Frazier Mountain... Highway 33 from Lockwood Valley Road to the Santa Barbara County line... Ventucopa... Pyramid Lake... and Interstate 5 over the Grapevine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Ventura County Valleys; Cuyama Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Ventura County Mountains
